roomai.bridge package¶

Submodules¶

roomai.bridge.BridgeAction module¶

class roomai.bridge.BridgeAction.BridgeAction(stage, bidding_option, bidding_point, bidding_suit, playing_pokercard)[source]¶

Bases: roomai.common.common.AbstractAction

The action of Bridge. There are two stages:1) bidding and 2) playing. The example of the Bridge action’s usages:

################ In the bidding stage, the action key looks like “bidding”_option_(point)_(suit). ################

## The option is one of “bid”,”double”,”redouble” and “pass”.

## When the option is “bid”, the point and suit are the candidate point (one of “A”,”2”,”3”,”4”,”5”,”6” and “7”)and suit (one of “NotTrump”,”Spade”,”Heart”,”Diamond” and “Club”). ## When the option is “double” or “redouble” or “pass”. No point and suit. The action key looks like bidding_option

>>action = roomai.bridge.BridgeAction.lookup(“bidding_bid_A_Heart”) ## We strongly recommend you to use the lookup fuction to get an action.

>>action.key

“bidding_bid_A_Heart”

>>action.stage

“bidding” >>action.bidding_option

“bid”

>>action.bidding_contract_point

“A”

>>action.bidding_contract_suit

“Heart”

>>action = roomai.bridge.BridgeAction.lookup(“bidding_pass”)

>>action.bidding_option

“pass”

################ In the playing stage, the action key looks like “playing”_point_suit.################

>> action = roomai.bridge.BridgeAction.lookup(“playing_A_heart”) ## We strongly recommend you to use the lookup fuction to get an action.

>> action.key

“playing_A_heart”

>>action.stage

“playing” >>action.playing_card.point

“A”

>>action.playing_card.point_rank

12

>>action.playing_card.suit

“Heart”

>>action.playing_card.suit_rank

2

bidding_contract_point¶

When stage = “bidding” and bidding_option = “bid”, the bidding_contract_point is one of [“A”,”2”,”3”,”4”,”5”,”6” and “7”]. When stage = “bidding” and bidding_option != “bid”,the bidding_contract_point is always None When stage = “playing”, the bidding_contract_point is always None

bidding_contract_suit¶

When stage = “bidding” and bidding_option = “bid”, the bidding_contract_suit is one of “NotTrump”,”Spade”,”Heart”, “Diamond” and “Club”. When stage = “bidding” and bidding_option != “bid”, the bidding_contract_suit is always None when stage == “playing”, the bidding_contract_suit is always None

bidding_option¶

When stage = “bidding”, the bidding_option is one of “bid”,”double”,”redouble” and “pass”. When stage = “playing”, the bidding_option is always None

key¶

The key of the Bridge action. For example, >>action = roomai.bridge.BridgeAction.lookup(“bidding_bid_1_Heart”) >>action.key “bidding_bid_A_Heart” ## bidding means the bidding stage, bid means the bid option, A means the 1 card point, Heart means the card suit

classmethod lookup(key)[source]¶

lookup an action with the key

Parameters:key – the key of the targeted action
Returns:the action with this key
playing_card¶

When stage == “bidding”, the playing_card always be None When stage = “playing”, the playing_card is the card in this Bridge action. For example, >>action = roomai.bridge.BridgeAction.lookup(“playing_A_Heart”) >>action.playing_card.key “A_Heart” >>action.playing_card.point “A” >>action.playing_card.suit “Heart” >>action.playing_card.point_rank 12 >>action.playing_card.suit_rank 1

stage¶

The stage of Bridge. For example, >>action = room.bridge_BridgeAction.lookup(“playing_A_Heart”) >>action.stage “playing”

roomai.bridge.BridgeInfo module¶

class roomai.bridge.BridgeInfo.BridgePersonState[source]¶

Bases: roomai.common.common.AbstractPersonState

The person state of Bridge

hand_cards_dict¶

The hand cards in the corresponding player. For example, hand_cards_dict = {“A_Heart”:roomai.bridge.BridgePokerCard.lookup(“A_Heart”), “A_Spade”:roomai.bridge.BridgePokerCard.lookup(“A_Spade”)}

class roomai.bridge.BridgeInfo.BridgePrivateState[source]¶

Bases: roomai.common.common.AbstractPrivateState

The private state of Bridge

class roomai.bridge.BridgeInfo.BridgePublicState[source]¶

Bases: roomai.common.common.AbstractPublicState

The public state of Bridge.

The attributes whose names start with “bidding” are used in the bidding stage The attributes whose names start with “playing” are used in the playing stage

bidding_candidate_contract_point¶

The candidate contract point at the bidding stage. The candidate contract point is one of ‘7’, ‘6’, ‘5’, ‘4’, ‘3’, ‘2’, ‘A’ and None

bidding_candidate_contract_suit¶

The candidate contract suit at the bidding stage. The candidate contract suit is one of “NotTrump”,”Spade”,”Heart”, “Diamond”,”Club” and None]. At the beginning of the bidding stage, the candidate_contract_suit is None

bidding_last_bidder¶

In the bidding stage, the last playerid who lastly takes the “bid” action. The bidding_last_bidder is one of [roomai.bridge.Direction.north,roomai.bridge.Direction.east, roomai.bridge.Direction.south,roomai.bridge.Direction.west]. For example, the bidding_last_bidder = roomai.bridge.Direction.west

bidding_magnification¶

In the bidding stage, normally, the magnification = 1. The “double” action makes magnification = 2, and the “redouble” makes magnification = 4

playing_card_turn¶

The players[turn] uses the players[playing_card_turn]’s cards to take an action. In general, turn == playing_card_turn. When playing_card_turn = dummy, turn = playing_dealerid

playing_cards_on_table¶

The playing_cards_on_table is the cards so far in this pier. For example, playing_cards_on_table = [roomai.bridge.BridgePokerCard.lookup(“A_Spade”),roomai.bridge.BridgePokerCard.lookup(“2_Spade”)] when two players have taken actions in this pier.

playing_contract_point¶

The contract point at the playing stage. The contract point is one of ‘A’,’K’,’Q’,’J’,‘10’,‘9’,‘8’,‘7’, ‘6’, ‘5’, ‘4’, ‘3’, ‘2’ and ‘A’.

playing_contract_suit¶

The contract suit at the playing stage. The candidate contract suit is one of “Spade”,”Heart”, “Diamond” and “Club”.

playing_dealerid¶

The players[playing_dealerid] is the dealer

playing_is_vulnerable¶

The playing_is_vulnerable will affect the final scores. In general, playing_is_vulnerable = [False,False,False,False].

playing_magnification¶

The playing_magnification will affect the final scores. In general, playing_magnification = 1. The valid double in the bidding stage will make playing_magnification = 2 and the valid redouble will make playing_magnification = 4

playing_win_tricks_sofar¶

playing_win_tricks_sofar is the number of the win tricks. For example, playing_win_tricks_sofar = [1,2,1,2] means 1) that players[0] and players[2] win 1 trick, and 2) that players[1] and players[3] win 2 tricks.

stage¶

There are two stages: “bidding” and “playing”

roomai.bridge.BridgeUtils module¶

class roomai.bridge.BridgeUtils.BridgePokerCard(point, suit=None)[source]¶

Bases: roomai.common.common.PokerCard

A poker card used in Bridge

The suit ranks in the common poker card(roomai.common.PokerCard) and the Bridge poker card(roomai.bridge.BridgePokerCard) are different:

The common poker card: ‘Spade’: 0, ‘Heart’:1, ‘Diamond’:2, ‘Club’:3 The Bridge poker card:’Spade’: 0, ‘Heart’: 1, ‘Diamond’: 2, ‘Club’:3

class roomai.bridge.BridgeUtils.Direction[source]¶
east = 1¶
north = 0¶
south = 2¶
west = 3¶
